record.title: Transcript of interview with Maya Miller by Kit Miller, February 24, 1993
record.description: An interview with Maya Miller conducted by her daughter, Kit Miller regarding her early involvement with the League of Women Voters. This interview highlights Maya Miller's membership and leadership roles within the nation and local League chapters. The primary focus of this information is the League's involvement in the War on Poverty and civil rights issues in Nevada.

record.title: Transcript of interview with Maya Miller by Kit Miller, March 31, 1993
record.description: An interview with Maya Miller conducted by her daughter, Kit Miller regarding involvement in the Civil Rights Movement of the late 1960s and early 1970s and her subsequent arrest following protests at the Census Bureau office in Reno. A group of black students and other community leaders were protesting the discriminatory hiring practices of the Census Bureau in Reno when the police arrived to break up the demonstration. Maya Miller was arrested for obstructing justice and resisting arrest. She went on to appeal her case and file a counter suit against the city of Reno.
record.creator: Miller, Kit (Nevada);
record.subject: Gomes, Nancy, 1926-1979
League of Women Voters of Nevada; Women social reformers; Women political activists; Police--Community relations; Social problems and social issues;

record.title: Transcript of interview with Maya Miller by Kit Miller regarding Washoe Pines Ranch, March 19, 1993
record.description: An interview with Maya Miller conducted by her daughter, Kit Miller regarding the purchase of the Washoe Pines Ranch, the subsequent establishment of the Foresta Institute, and the Washoe Pines summer camp. This interview encompasses two sessions and gives details about the origins of the Millers purchasing the Washoe Pines Ranch and anecdotes about running an ecology-based youth summer camp in the summers.

record.title: Transcript of interview with Maya Miller by KOH radio host, July 27, 2003
record.description: An interview with Maya Miller conducted by KOH radio host, Sheri Rice, which gives an overview of her life events and work. This interview was broadcast as part of the Sheri Rice radio program, in it Maya Miller discusses her early life in Southern California, her move to Nevada, her Senate campaign, events in Las Vegas in the early 1970s, and her feelings toward what she accomplished during her lifetime.

record.title: Transcript of interview with Maya Miller by Kit Miller regarding the war in Vietnam, March 5, 1993
record.description: An interview with Maya Miller conducted by her daughter, Kit Miller regarding her aversion to U.S. involvement in the war in Vietnam. This interview outlines Maya Miller's feelings on the war in Vietnam and her strained relationship with the League of Women Voters following a decision to not speak out against the war.

record.title: Transcript of interview with Maya Miller by Kit Miller, April 6, 1993
record.description: An interview with Maya Miller conducted by her daughter, Kit Miller regarding the National Rights Organziation and the march on the Las Vegas Strip in 1971. This interview highlights the activities of the National Welfare Rights Organization, Operation Nevada, and members of the National League of Women Voters in the winter of 1971 on the Las Vegas Strip where a march and sit-in was staged in protest of welfare laws.

record.title: Transcript of interview with Maya Miller by Kit Miller, March 3, 1993
record.description: An interview with Maya Miller conducted by her daughter, Kit Miller regarding her early involvement with Indian organizing in Nevada. This interview highlights issues surrounding the California-Nevada Interstate Compact and its impact on the Pyramid Lake Paiute Tribe and the health of Pyramid Lake. It also mentions Indian activism on Alcatraz island and at Wounded Knee.

record.title: Transcript of interview with Maya Miller by Kit Miller regarding Sand Harbor State Park, February 10, 1993
record.description: An interview with Maya Miller conducted by her daughter, Kit Miller regarding the fight to create Sand Harbor state park at Lake Tahoe, Nevada. In this interview Maya Miller discusses her connection to Lake Tahoe and the political process and money involved in securing and designating lands around Lake Tahoe for a state park. These events occured through much of the 1960s until the park was established in 1971.
